snippet: Almost two months after the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting, residents and officials are trying to figure out what to do with thousands of letters and other items.
abstract: Residents and officials of Newtown, Conn, are trying to figure out what to do with thousands of condolence cards, letters and other items, sent after the school massacre at Sandy Hook Elementary School, in a way that balances respect and practicality.
lead_paragraph: Almost two months after the Sandy Hook Elementary School shooting, residents and officials are trying to figure out what to do with thousands of letters and other items.

headline.seo: In Newtown, an Effort to Preserve a Mountain of Sympathy Cards
headline.main: With Care, Newtown Tries to Move On Amid Tokens of Grief
headline.print_headline: With Care, Newtown Tries to Move On Amid Tokens of Grief
